In response to the decline of extraction activities, federal and state agencies have sought to replace lost economic activity with initiatives focused on restoration work. The Northwest Forest Plan, established in 1994, initiated several programs aimed at transitioning traditional logging communities and workforces towards sustainable livelihoods in restoration efforts.
